alert.note: Alert for Dragoon, Mule, Huachuca and Santa Rita Mountains including Bisbee, Canelo Hills, Madera Canyon; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox; Upper San Pedro River Valley including Sierra Vista, Benson; Upper Santa Cruz River and Altar Valleys including Nogales (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 7:27PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cochise and eastern Santa Cruz Counties through 815 PM MST... At 727 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sierra Vista, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sierra Vista, Bisbee, Hereford, Whetstone, Huachuca City, Naco, Elgin, Fort Huachuca, Parker Canyon Lake, Palominas, Charleston, Canelo, Coronado National Memorial and Ramsey Canyon Preserve. This includes the following highways... Route 80 between mile markers 320 and 342. Route 82 between mile markers 49 and 53. Route 83 between mile markers 3 and 23. Route 90 between mile markers 309 and 336. Route 92 between mile markers 322 and 354. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
